title: The Often Irrational Rationing of Vaccines
sub_head: Why is eligibility is expanded when the highest priority group of those wanting vaccines hasn’t yet been completely vaccinated?
body:
Regarding your editorial “How to Ration Vaccines” (Feb. 5): Regardless of the priorities that are established by various authorities, I have yet to see an explanation as to why eligibility is expanded when the highest-priority group of those who would most benefit from vaccines hasn’t yet been completely vaccinated. It only makes it harder for that group to schedule an appointment.
David Ockene
Mount Vernon, N.Y.

If age is used as a primary determinant for Covid-19 vaccine allocation, millions of Americans living with life-shortening diseases will be left behind. I am one of those people. I am living with cystic fibrosis (CF), a rare genetic disease that commands a median age of death of about 32 years old and affects some 30,000 Americans.
